core

Class Rational

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Rational
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Rational>

    public class Rational
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Rational>
    This class represents a Rational number. A rational number can be expressed in the form of p/q, where p and are integers, q ≠ 0.

    All rationals have a finite or repeating decimal sequence.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Subhomoy Haldar

      Creates a new Rational with the given (long) numerator and denominator, reduced to its lowest terms.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Rational term)
        Compares the given Rational with the current one. Returns a negative integer if this Rational is smaller, positive if this is larger and zero if both are equal.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Rational>
        Parameters:
        term - The other Rational term to compare with.
        Returns:
        A negative integer if this Rational is smaller, positive if this is larger and zero if both are equal.
